name: 5.16 & 5.17 "Never Love a Goalie" Online Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the cold opening, how many hours did Norm say went by fast?
questions.explanation:
17.

	Norm had spent the entire day at Cheers. When he had to leave he commented that 17 hours goes by really fast.

questions.text: Who got picked for jury duty?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Not only did Diane get picked for jury duty, she was also made the foreman of the jury. She could not help but talk about the case, but did it in ways that she didn't directly say "This is what's happening in this case".

questions.text: What team did Eddie Lebec play for?
questions.explanation:
Boston Bruins.

	The Boston Bruins are a part of the Atlantic Division of the Eastern Conference in the National Hockey League. They became a team in 1924. Eddie Lebec was not a name of an actual Bruins player, he was just made up for the show.

questions.text: What did Eddie drink before every game?
questions.correct: white club soda, no ice, two slices of lime and a red straw
options: martini with an olive and salt on the glass
questions.explanation:
white club soda, no ice, two slices of lime and a red straw.

	Carla commented that he was superstitious but he denied it. We learn that both he and Carla are very superstitious people.

questions.text: Who went to the hockey game with Carla?
questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	Sam suggested that Carla take Frasier since Frasier was feeling down. At the game Frasier got into a fight and had to be bailed out of jail.

questions.text: What did the other jurors think about the case?
questions.explanation:
He was not guilty.

	Diane believed that the man was guilty but no one else did. In the end even the wife didn't think he was guilty any longer, until they came to Cheers and Diane made her rethink it.

questions.text: What did the guys draw straws to tell Carla?
questions.explanation:
She's a jinx.

	Everyone believed that Eddie started playing badly because of Carla. Carla believed that as well but didn't want to face it because she really liked Eddie.

questions.text: Why did Carla say she wanted Eddie to leave?
questions.explanation:
They just didn't work anymore.

	Carla decided that she had to break up with Eddie so he would play better. She was hoping that he would still play badly to prove she wasn't a jinx.

questions.text: After Carla dumped Eddie, did Boston win its next game?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	Carla was hoping they'd lose so she'd prove she wasn't a jinx. However, they're winning only proved to her and the others that she was a jinx. Eddie figured out why she dumped him and thought it wasn't fair he had to lose her because of his hockey playing. They end up finding away around it, and broke up right before every hockey game.

questions.text: What did the man who won the trial order?
questions.explanation:
Bloody Mary.

	The man was accused of attempted murder. Diane thought his drink choice was ironic because of that.
